boat.name: Bethany
boat.full_description: She has a jib head topsail which is easily handled. The mainsail has 3 slab reefs, 1 in the staysail and the jib is on a Wykham-Martin furler with a smaller no 2 option.  With a slippery hull, new sails and a feathering propeller, she is very competitive when racing and a fast, dry cruising boat.  She sleeps 5, a double in the forepeak, 2 full length settee berths and a pilot berth in the saloon yet is easily single handed with a tiller pilot and the excellent sea feather winvane steering gear.  The saloon seats 6 around the drop leaf table, the galley has a 2 burner cooker with grill and oven, a sink and cold water pump, and ample storage. The heads is uncommonly aft, handy underway and more private than amidships at night.
boat.short_description: Bethany is a very rare flush decked Heard 28, so has a large uncluttered foredeck, standing headroom below, and true workboat lines.

for_sales.sales_text: Bethany sports many improvements and replacements including sail by Crusader, a noble mast, Darglow featherstream propeller, new Beta 30 inboard engine, windvane steering, running rigging, rebuilt rudder and stainless steel fittings, cooker, vhf with ais and gps, new summer covers, an all over winter cover as well as cockpit and decks repainted and varnish work recoated yearly.
